sen.j: 大石 信興（おおいし のぶおき、延宝2年(1674年) - 寛保元年9月6日 (旧暦)（1741年10月15日））は、江戸時代前期の武士。
sen.e: Nobuoki OISHI (1674 to October 15, 1741) was a samurai in the early Edo period.
Nobuoki OISHI (1674 to October 15, 1741) was a samurai in the early Edo period.
Nobuoki OISHI (1674 to October 15, 1741) was a samurai in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 赤穂藩主浅野内匠頭の家臣。
sen.e: He was a vassal of ASANO Takumi no Kami, the lord of the Ako clan.
He was a vassal of ASANO Takumi no Kami, the lord of the Ako clan.
He was a vassal of ASANO Takumi no Kami, the lord of the Ako clan.

sen.j: 47士の1人である大石信清の兄にあたる。
sen.e: He was the elder brother of Nobukiyo OISHI, who was one of the 47 samurais.
He was an elder brother of Nobukiyo OISHI, who was one of the 47 samurais of Ako.
He was an elder brother of Nobukiyo OISHI, who was one of the 47 samurais of Ako.

sen.j: 通称は孫四郎（まごしろう）、のち帯刀（たてわき）。
sen.e: His common name was Magoshiro, and later on Tatewaki.
His common name was Magoshiro, and later on Tatewaki.
His common name was Magoshiro, and later on Tatewaki.

sen.j: 名ははじめ信明（のぶあき）。
sen.e: His name was Hajime Nobuaki.
His name was originally Hajime Nobuaki.
His name was originally Hajime Nobuaki.

sen.j: そのあと信興と名を変えたが、信興ではなく信豊（のぶとよ）だとも言われる。
sen.e: Though he changed his name later to Nobuoki, it is said that it was not Nobuoki but Nobutoyo.
Later he changed his name to Nobuoki, but it is said that it may be not Nobuoki but Nobutoyo.
sen.cmt: 「名前を変えた」が中心的な内容ですので、こちらを主節にすべきです。
sen.e: Later he changed his name to Nobuoki, but it is said that it may be not Nobuoki but Nobutoyo.

sen.j: 延宝2年（1674年）赤穂浅野家家臣の大石信澄（知行450石）の長男として誕生。
sen.e: In 1674, he was born as the eldest son of Nobuzumi OISHI (with an annual stipend of 450 Koku of crop yield), who was a vassal of the ASANO family of the Ako clan.
In 1674, he was born as the eldest son of Nobuzumi OISHI (with an annual stipend of 450 Koku of crop yield), who was a vassal of the ASANO family of the Ako clan.
In 1674, he was born as the eldest son of Nobuzumi OISHI (with an annual stipend of 450 Koku of crop yield), who was a vassal of the ASANO family of the Ako clan.

sen.j: 母は小田貞守の娘。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Sadamori ODA.
His mother was a daughter of Sadamori ODA.
His mother was a daughter of Sadamori ODA.

sen.j: 幼名は右衛門太郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Uemontaro.
His childhood name was Uemontaro.
His childhood name was Uemontaro.

sen.j: 元禄2年（1689年）12月、父の死去により家督を相続。
sen.e: In December, 1689, he was inherited with the family estate after his father's death.
In December, 1689, he inherited the family estate after his father's death.
sen.cmt: 受動態では意味をなしません。
sen.e: In December, 1689, he inherited the family estate after his father's death.

sen.j: 孫四郎の通称も受け継いだ。
sen.e: He also succeeded to the common name Magoshiro.
He also succeeded to the common name Magoshiro.
He also succeeded to the common name Magoshiro.

sen.j: また450石のうち150石を弟瀬左衛門信清に分け与えている。
sen.e: Moreover, he gave 150 Koku out of 450 Koku to his younger brother Nobukiyo SEZAEMON.
Moreover, he gave 150 Koku out of 450 Koku to his younger brother Nobukiyo SEZAEMON.
Moreover, he gave 150 Koku out of 450 Koku to his younger brother Nobukiyo SEZAEMON.

sen.j: 赤穂藩改易後、弟とともに大石内蔵助の盟約に名を連ねた。
sen.e: After the attainder of the Ako clan, he, together with younger brother, added his name to the alliance pledge of Kuranosuke OISH.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the attainder of the Ako clan, he, together with his younger brother, joined the alliance pledge of Kuranosuke OISH.
sen.cmt: 「名を連ねた」を直訳するよりjoinで表した方が簡潔です。
sen.e: After the attainder of the Ako clan, he, together with his younger brother, joined the alliance pledge of Kuranosuke OISH.

sen.j: しかし、元禄15年（1702年）閏8月の神文返しの際に12日付けで脱盟した。
sen.e: However, in August of 1702, when the Shinmon was returned, he withdrew from the alliance, dated 12.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, when the Shinmon was returned in 1702, he withdrew from the alliance as of October 3.
sen.cmt: 新暦に変換しました。旧暦の「閏8月」は新暦では9月か10月になってしまうので、閏8月は訳出せず、日付の方を10月3日としました。
sen.e: However, when the Shinmon was returned in 1702, he withdrew from the alliance as of October 3.

sen.j: この脱盟について自分か瀬左衛門のどちらかは生母の面倒を見ねばならないということで瀬左衛門とくじでどちらが脱盟するか決めたという逸話がある。
sen.e: Concerning his withdrawal from the alliance, it was because that either of he or Sezaemon had to look after their mother, and there was an anecdote saying that they decided on who was going to withdraw by drawing lots.

Concerning his withdrawal from the alliance, he and Sezaemon drew the lottery in order to decide which of them would withdraw from the alliance because one of them had to look after their mother, according to anecdotes.
sen.cmt: 元の英文の文構造を整理しました。
sen.e: Concerning his withdrawal from the alliance, he and Sezaemon drew the lottery in order to decide which of them would withdraw from the alliance because one of them had to look after their mother, according to anecdotes.

sen.j: その後は母とともに讃岐国高松へ住み、やがて関白近衛家熙に仕えた。
sen.e: Afterward, he lived with his mother in Takamatsu, Sanuki Province, and soon started serving Iehiro KONOE, the chief adviser to the Emperor.
Afterward, he lived with his mother in Takamatsu, Sanuki Province, and soon started serving Iehiro KONOE, the chief adviser to the Emperor.

sen.j: 母も近衛家に出仕し、外山局と称した。
sen.e: His mother also served the KONOE family, and was called Toyama no Tsubone.
His mother also served the Konoe family, and was called Toyama no Tsubone.
sen.cmt: 家名は頭文字のみ大文字で表記します。
sen.e: His mother also served the Konoe family, and was called Toyama no Tsubone.

sen.j: この大石孫四郎は、討ち入りに加わらなかった｢不忠臣｣で恐らく唯一再仕官が叶った人物である。
sen.e: This Magoshiro OISHI, who was a "Disloyalty retainer" that did not join the raid, was perhaps the only person who managed to re-enter the government service.
This Magoshiro OISHI, who was a "disloyal retainer" that did not join the raid, was perhaps the only person that managed to re-enter the government service.
sen.cmt: 名詞retainerを修飾するので形容詞disloyalとします。先行詞にonlyがついている場合、関係代名詞はthatを用います。
sen.e: This Magoshiro OISHI, who was a "disloyal retainer" that did not join the raid, was perhaps the only person that managed to re-enter the government service.

sen.j: 従兄弟の大石良穀も近衛家に仕えていたので、その縁故を頼ったものかもしれない。
sen.e: Since his cousin Yoshitake OISHI also served the KONOE family, it might be perhaps because of this relation.
Since his cousin Yoshitake OISHI also served the Konoe family, he might have used this connection.
sen.cmt: 主節を具体的に言い換えました。
sen.e: Since his cousin Yoshitake OISHI also served the Konoe family, he might have used this connection.

sen.j: その後、一時期浪人した。
sen.e: Afterward, he was a wanderer for a certain period of time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Afterward, he became a ronin(masterless samurai) for a while.
sen.cmt: 「浪人」の訳出は用語集を参照しました。
sen.e: Afterward, he became a ronin(masterless samurai) for a while.

sen.j: しかし、天皇家に直接召抱えられて廷臣となり、禁裏御使番などをつとめている。
sen.e: However, he became a courtier receiving summons directly from the Emperor's family, an Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) for the Imperial Palace, and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, he became a courtier, receiving summons directly from the Emperor's family, and served as an Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) for the Imperial Palace, and so on.
sen.cmt: 動詞becameの後ろに複数の目的語や分詞構文を続けては意味が分かりにくくなるので、動詞を補いました。
sen.e: However, he became a courtier, receiving summons directly from the Emperor's family, and served as an Otsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) for the Imperial Palace, and so on.

sen.j: 元文2年7月に隠居し、道入と称した。
sen.e: He retired in July, 1737, titled Donyu.

sen.j: 寛保元年9月6日に死去。
sen.e: He died on September 6, 1741.
